title: Ex gratia
text:
(; also spelled "ex-gratia") is <a href="Latin">Latin</a> for "by favour", and is most often used in a <a href="legal">legal</a> context. When something has been done "ex gratia", it has been done voluntarily, out of kindness or grace. In <a href="law">law</a>, an "ex gratia payment" is a payment made without the giver recognising any <a href="Legal%20liability">liability</a> or legal obligation.
Examples.
Compensation payments are often made ex gratia if a <a href="government">government</a> or organization is prepared to compensate victims of an event such as an <a href="accident">accident</a> or similar but not to admit liability to pay compensation or for causing the event.
